snippet.textDisplay: Doing physics in univ, for example speed of light (yeah, 30 years ago...) tests with rather strong lasers etc it was OK if we hit within 1e10..15 - just as long as we explained where error marginals came from. That latter part is more important than hitting target. So come on... If you measure something, do it again and again in different ways until you say it's inaccurate.

snippet.textDisplay: If axions, assuming they exist and are the dark matter physicists have been looking for, are produced in the core of fairly unremarkable star like our sun, is the next question why the stars in those dark matter free galaxies that have been discovered haven’t been producing axions? For that matter if loads of axions were produced during the Big Bang wouldn’t we expect them to end up in the same regions and structures as ordinary matter, and for there to be no galaxies without them? Or is there a possible answer that’s the subject of a future video?
snippet.textOriginal: If axions, assuming they exist and are the dark matter physicists have been looking for, are produced in the core of fairly unremarkable star like our sun, is the next question why the stars in those dark matter free galaxies that have been discovered haven’t been producing axions? snippet.textDisplay: I really don't believe in the existence of what they called axions. And even less in "WIMPS". There are better solutions to our physics problems and we will understand one day. I do think we are limited by the realist view on what we observe, it's still a too common interpretation among physicists. And the fact that they all want to invent solutions to problems between what we can verify and what we expect to verify in a way that they seem to want our universe to be a closed system that exists in itself, and is not part of anything more.
snippet.textOriginal: I really don't believe in the existence of what they called axions. And even less in "WIMPS". There are better solutions to our physics problems and we will understand one day. Μὴ δῶτε τὸ ἅγιον τοῖς κυσὶν μηδὲ βάλητε τοὺς μαργαρίτας
ὑμῶν ἔμπροσθεν τῶν χοίρων μήποτε καταπατήσουσιν αὐτοὺς
ἐν τοῖς ποσὶν αὐτῶν καὶ στραφέντες ῥήξωσιν ὑμᾶς.

snippet.textDisplay: Could someone pls make a anthropomorphized cartoon about quantum particle behavior to make this understandable? There is so much going on in nearly anything. From vacuum to simple atoms. Quarks, Leptons, Bosons and so on... I'm clearly not able to imagine what is going on anymore. Sure, I could eat some shrooms, but damn. Can anyone put this together to make a clear image to look at? Like oldschool 60's atoms, just by modern standards. I have seen so many visualizations of "this", but it is really hard to put it in some context. So how many dimensions do I need to understand gravity in its simplest form - 11?

snippet.textDisplay: No light if caught in a field and and can no longer travel the speed of light then can no longer be considered light . The property of light says light travels 186,000 miles a second in a vacume, if it doesn't then it must be something else .what was it before it became light ? Simple energy, potential energy .I think anything can be light if accelerated to the speed of light. Perhaps if trapped in a field it can not release it's energy as heat because there is nothing to transfer it too so it precipitates out as some type of particle .Perhaps dark matter .Perhaps as the elements it was before being accelarated, perhaps that's why the elements can be known within a star by analyzing its light or by slowing it below the speed of light in a field.

snippet.textDisplay:
When I watch PBS SpaceTime on Valentines Day and am sleep deprived, I Write stuff like this:

Quantum Love 0
-Time... to travel

„You are not here!“ says the voice from the Navigation tool, while marking my position with an X.
„Typical...“ I sigh so loud my ears might start bleeding.
So neither there I am...
Just lost in a time between the spaces.
Remembered only by future dreamers long forgotten.
They look like you and I, in the Review mirror of my Not-Delorian.
Dancing in the Starlight, that in the end might just have been an incoming truck.
I curse causality for making time as it always has been.
No chance for us pushing further to go back and help you against whatever came your way.
Fixing your past before you would have known that it would break.
So you would not be scarred by the sharp edges.
Even if this means making me obsolete in your life.
A footnote in the diary you then never could have written.

At least like this, I could sleep in knowledge of you never having loved me to begin with, a price that's worth to carry with me.

Alas... not even my mind belongs to me. So how could I change the past by going forward on this path of shattered chances?

How much I ever wished your tears would flow backwards, to turn your frown upside down.
It was never meant to be. My rage without a target to hit. Nothing to kill but time itself.
This goal is just unreachable, like a Star that explodes backwards in Time.
So vast and simply... impossible.
I cannot accept these facts and keep fighting against a past where I am, Not as now I will never be... ...and you not even known to me.
Still: I'd burn a Galaxy to keep your pain away. to never let it happen again for a first time.
But as all of us: You cannot stop to run. Because time always just falls in step with you.
Might as well make the best of it while the metronome keeps ticking.
My heart beats 32768 times a second.
So by all that it has done, my heart should be; with all the rights of Mass/Matter conversion, just be stone.
Your presence softens it a bit. By bit, by bit, by bit.

Trying to change the past is a goal
just made for fools and errors.
To shape the future by the Actions in the now
is a task for heroes.
With a sense of wonder, how you ever got so strong.
Not wanting for the past to change at all.
Just packing your Backpack on your back to never look back.

I focus my Rearwardview on my Backtracking Machine.Put it from driving backwards once more and never, into reverse to return from the past into the now.

To see my yet. And all that is; still, not done in it.

88 miles per Hour into my here, seems so slow compared to you.
Walking with confidence inside yourself, while I stumble between the strings of a past reality.

No one knows what path you will choose, once a fork has been presented.
Your lifepath is like, the most beautiful double slit experiment!
But am I, with you entangled?

Your Love, in some of the times. just a particle.
Cannot touch it, to my dismay.
Sometimes your love was, and may be, a wave sweeping me away.
I do not mind. As long as you find laughter on your way.
snippet.textOriginal:
When I watch PBS SpaceTime on Valentines Day and am sleep deprived, I Write stuff like this:

-Quantum Love 0-
-Time... to travel

„You are not here!“ says the voice from the Navigation tool, while marking my position with an X.
„Typical...“ I sigh so loud my ears might start bleeding.
So neither there I am...
Just lost in a time between the spaces.
Remembered only by future dreamers long forgotten.
They look like you and I, in the Review mirror of my Not-Delorian.
Dancing in the Starlight, that in the end might just have been an incoming truck.
I curse causality for making time as it always has been.
No chance for us pushing further to go back and help you against whatever came your way.
Fixing your past before you would have known that it would break.
So you would not be scarred by the sharp edges.
Even if this means making me obsolete in your life.
A footnote in the diary you then never could have written.

At least like this, I could sleep in knowledge of you never having loved me to begin with, a price that's worth to carry with me.

Alas... not even my mind belongs to me. So how could I change the past by going forward on this path of shattered chances?

How much I ever wished your tears would flow backwards, to turn your frown upside down.
It was never meant to be. My rage without a target to hit. Nothing to kill but time itself.
This goal is just unreachable, like a Star that explodes backwards in Time.
So vast and simply... impossible.
I cannot accept these facts and keep fighting against a past where I am, Not as now I will never be... ...and you not even known to me.
Still: I'd burn a Galaxy to keep your pain away. to never let it happen again for a first time.
But as all of us: You cannot stop to run. Because time always just falls in step with you.
Might as well make the best of it while the metronome keeps ticking.
My heart beats 32768 times a second.
So by all that it has done, my heart should be; with all the rights of Mass/Matter conversion, just be stone.
Your presence softens it a bit. By bit, by bit, by bit.

Trying to change the past is a goal
just made for fools and errors.
To shape the future by the Actions in the now
is a task for heroes.
With a sense of wonder, how you ever got so strong.
Not wanting for the past to change at all.
Just packing your Backpack on your back to never look back.

I focus my Rearwardview on my Backtracking Machine.Put it from driving backwards once more and never, into reverse to return from the past into the now.

To see my yet. And all that is; still, not done in it.

88 miles per Hour into my here, seems so slow compared to you.
Walking with confidence inside yourself, while I stumble between the strings of a past reality.

No one knows what path you will choose, once a fork has been presented.
Your lifepath is like, the most beautiful double slit experiment!
But am I, with you entangled?

Your Love, in some of the times. just a particle.
Cannot touch it, to my dismay.
Sometimes your love was, and may be, a wave sweeping me away.
I do not mind. As long as you find laughter on your way.

snippet.textDisplay:
so, am i getting this right - axions basically explain how particles can appear to come from nothing, by being like another layer of temporary particles before virtual particles?

If so what's the difference between axions and "particles more fundamental than others", is it that a photon is not broken apart into axions & axions just change to other particles because that's more stable? why does such a small change like that alter the physics of the particle so much
(i always thought of quantum particles as being like chemical reactions so it made sense to me quarks could build nucleons with different physics, or even that two particles could "react" to form two others of the same 'size' if energy is conserved, but i'm confused why one axion would just become a photon, or i suppose 'where the energy went'.)

could axion/vacuum mathematics maybe clear up what's going on with the double slit experiment??
snippet.textOriginal:

snippet.textDisplay:
Is it not more probable that Dark Matter is simply particles that operate and only exist in higher dimensionality? If Super Strings can operate within 11 dimensions is it not also possible for some particle to exist in the upper limit of this dimensionality, ergo only 4th, 5th, 6th dimensions respectively?


These influences make sense, This gives them the "space" to move around matter that has a lower dimensionality then its own. It will also explain they interact and exert Gravity, because gravity is a connective quantum field, meaning it distorts space-time. Since they exisit in a higher energy state it is also possible that they have a higher 'relative' weight.


Higher dimensional space can even be measured using amplituhedron and maybe to the extent of a higher dimensional particle.


In my summation this new interconnected "set" of fields constitutes a "Realm". Where in the entirety of Existence is arranged into an 11th dimensional Torus (upper limit 12 dimentional).


Where the 12th dimension constitutes the circumference or perimeter, if you will, of the torus.


This structure even gives rise to the Saddle shape of space time.


Well I hoped this helped :)
snippet.textOriginal:
Is it not more probable that Dark Matter is simply particles that operate and only exist in higher dimensionality? If Super Strings can operate within 11 dimensions is it not also possible for some particle to exist in the upper limit of this dimensionality, ergo only 4th, 5th, 6th dimensions respectively?


These influences make sense, This gives them the "space" to move around matter that has a lower dimensionality then its own. It will also explain they interact and exert Gravity, because gravity is a connective quantum field, meaning it distorts space-time. Since they exisit in a higher energy state it is also possible that they have a higher 'relative' weight.


Higher dimensional space can even be measured using amplituhedron and maybe to the extent of a higher dimensional particle.


 In my summation this new interconnected "set" of fields constitutes a "Realm". Where in the entirety of Existence is arranged into an 11th dimensional Torus (upper limit 12 dimentional).


Where the 12th dimension constitutes the circumference or perimeter, if you will, of the torus. 


This structure even gives rise to the Saddle shape of space time.


Well I hoped this helped :)

snippet.textDisplay:
Query: When counting the mass of the universe, did they account for the variance caused by gravity?

Einstein postulated that there is no experiment that tells the difference between gravity & an accelerating frame of reference. When an object accelerates, it gains mass ... relative to an inerial frame of reference (FoR). Since we are in an accelerating FoR, the adjustments to mass should swing both ways: particles that have been accelerated should have lower masses & particles undergoing greater acceleration should have more mass (at least as I understand the math).
snippet.textOriginal:
Query: When counting the mass of the universe, did they account for the variance caused by gravity?

Einstein postulated that there is no experiment that tells the difference between gravity & an accelerating frame of reference. When an object accelerates, it gains mass ... relative to an inerial frame of reference (FoR). Since we are in an accelerating FoR, the adjustments to mass should swing both ways: particles that have been accelerated should have lower masses & particles undergoing greater acceleration should have more mass (at least as I understand the math).

snippet.textDisplay:
If there were a quark with zero mass, wouldn't the other quarks preferentially decay into that quark the same way the muon and tau particles decay into electrons? Or is there something else preventing this, such as that only applying to free particles, which quarks can never be due to confinement?

And if it had zero mass, could it even be bound in the first place?

Seems like a zero mass quark would be ruled out by observation unless either they all were zero mass, or at the very least the up and down were both zero mass.

Or maybe I'm missing something completely. I'm an Astrophys major, so my knowledge of particle physics is admittedly patchy... at best...
snippet.textOriginal:
If there were a quark with zero mass, wouldn't the other quarks preferentially decay into that quark the same way the muon and tau particles decay into electrons? Or is there something else preventing this, such as that only applying to free particles, which quarks can never be due to confinement?

And if it had zero mass, could it even *be* bound in the first place?

Seems like a zero mass quark would be ruled out by observation unless either they all were zero mass, or at the very least the up and down were both zero mass.

Or maybe I'm missing something completely. I'm an Astrophys major, so my knowledge of particle physics is admittedly patchy... at best...

snippet.textDisplay: So, there is a problem with the idea of using an artificially created magnetic field to change the axions back to protons. The calibration of a field that strong to create a focused point would require incredible tuning, and sense we live on a geo-magnetic object that fluctuates it's magnetic field, these calibrations can't be done. This experiment needs to be done in space away from geo-magnetic objects to achieve the fine point magnetic field to turn axions back to protons.
snippet.textOriginal: So, there is a problem with the idea of using an artificially created magnetic field to change the axions back to protons. The calibration of a field that strong to create a focused point would require incredible tuning, and sense we live on a geo-magnetic object that fluctuates it's magnetic field, these calibrations can't be done. This experiment needs to be done in space away from geo-magnetic objects to achieve the fine point magnetic field to turn axions back to protons.

snippet.textDisplay: why is it everyone seems to be looking for one thing that is dark matter, are they all really so stupid to think it is that easy. that one day one particle will pop up and fill the whole ? what whole ? the whole they had to fill in  astronomical simulations because they were not working the way they expected. matter was missing.  so they plugged the whole to get it to work right and poof someone called that "dark matter".  there is likely an arms length list of things that actually fit, along with a basic misunderstanding of some physics as well .

snippet.textDisplay:
Hi Matt. i'm aware it is not concerning the topic but how would you deal with someone so far in smooth brain that the person answered basicly with "photons have mass otherwise they would not have energy" and "we dont know for sure, there is no evidence that photons cannot go faster than light" and "light can travel faster than light" and "gravity is curvature of spacetime ? What startrek sh*t is that?" and "light have mass cuz it is affected by gravity". I think i know enough to say it is not because of mass but curved spacetime and escape velocity beeing unreachable and for anything with mass you can go close but not at speed of light because it would require more and more energy to gain lower and lower acceleration up to infinite ammount of energy. I know i am not genious but c'mon even if i said it is because light is going straight and space is curved so curve is actually straight and if it crosses event horizon it is too slow to escape , wouldn't be so much of a "streach". And that person even wrote that, and i sh*t you not, light have mass because sun have mass, and sun losses mass. Is it just me? Am i stupid or something? I know milk has been spilled and i kinda went all road rage on that poor thing and went even so fas as to paste link to PBS Spacetime and told him/her to get a book, paper one, a legit book on physics and read.
I know i probably went a bit too harsh but still, how would you react, how You handle those types of situation.


It all went over a meme here https://9gag.com/gag/aPRpEjw?ref=w.commentupvotenoti#cs_comment_id=c_158158107493361512
and my comment is uder name krzlew96 ... i tried to be original but all the names were taken soo. And i know i probably made some mistakes there, i was a bit angry at the time so i ight have slipped a bit.


Im asking because i would like to learn how to answer to such comments.

snippet.textDisplay: For the infinite typing monkeys, the "monkey" is only a metaphor anyway, which brings me to my take on the concept with the "infinite madden monkeys", where each monkey used their own copy of madden NFL (let's say madden NFL 20) to simulate the NFL season, right up to and including the Super Bowl, and even sim the future beyond that. Each sim differs from each other sim in some way, even if it's only really far into the future. Of course, one sim out of all of them would reflect what really happened, right up to and including the Chiefs' Super Bowl LIV victory over the 49ers. I would've put that as a comment on that last video, but my Switch (on which I was watching that video) wouldn't let me submit that comment...

snippet.textDisplay: 15:50 The square root of 10^10^123 is not 10^10^60; it's about 10^10^122.7 - which makes the argument even stronger, but the pedant in me cannot resist pointing out the mistake.
snippet.textOriginal: 15:50 The square root of 10^10^123 is not 10^10^60; it's about 10^10^122.7 - which makes the argument even stronger, but the pedant in me cannot resist pointing out the mistake.

snippet.textDisplay: VPN doesn't protect you from 3rd party ad providers tracking your traffic on the websites you visit because that is done through cookies. Most traffic on the important websites is also already encrypted with TLS 2.0, so even without VPN, no one can eavesdrop on your connection. Your home IP address is also dynamically assigned by the ISP (in other words, it changes) and doesn't really contain personally identifiable information (which, as I already said, is tracked through cookies). I'm honestly not sure what VPN is actually supposed to protect you from. I mean, thanks for sponsoring the video, I guess, but I kind of feel like you're taking advantage of the ignorance of the average person to push a (mostly) useless product.
snippet.textOriginal: VPN doesn't protect you from 3rd party ad providers tracking your traffic on the websites you visit because that is done through cookies. Most traffic on the important websites is also already encrypted with TLS 2.0, so even without VPN, no one can eavesdrop on your connection. Your home IP address is also dynamically assigned by the ISP (in other words, it changes) and doesn't really contain personally identifiable information (which, as I already said, is tracked through cookies). I'm honestly not sure what VPN is actually supposed to protect you from. I mean, thanks for sponsoring the video, I guess, but I kind of feel like you're taking advantage of the ignorance of the average person to push a (mostly) useless product.

snippet.textDisplay: A chimpanzee IS a monkey. According to cladistics a species never stops being what it is it just splits into ever smaller groups but never detaches from it's ancestors. Just like humans evolved from apes and therefore are apes, apes evolved from moneys and therefore chimpanzees ARE monkeys. As are humans.
snippet.textOriginal: A chimpanzee IS a monkey. According to cladistics a species never stops being what it is it just splits into ever smaller groups but never detaches from it's ancestors. snippet.textDisplay:
The way that theta function was described makes it seem like some sort if clock signal.

Now, before someone goes off on me. No, I don't think I live in the freakin' Matrix.

I do, however, think it would be a good idea to see how well the frequency of that function correlates with time dilation in different relativistic frames, provided that's even possible to calculate.

snippet.textDisplay:
Hi! Thank you very much for your entertaining and educational videos!

I've had some trouble trying to understand Hawking Radiation.

If spacetime warping around a black hole asymptotically approaches infinite, how does anything ever cross the event horizon, from the perspective of an external observer?

If the particle were a photon, wouldn't it be infinitely redshifted by the time it reached an external observer, and thus be undetectable?

If it were a massive particle at a higher orbit, how would it reduce the overall energy of the black hole? Wouldn't the spontaneous creation of a real, energetic particle cause the black hole to expand, as its causally preceding particle was still slowing down in its infinite descent towards the event horizon?

To expect to be able to observe this radiation seems like a violation of causality and conservation of energy. How have I misinterpreted the phenomena involved?
snippet.textOriginal:
Hi! Thank you very much for your entertaining and educational videos!

I've had some trouble trying to understand Hawking Radiation.

If spacetime warping around a black hole asymptotically approaches infinite, how does anything ever cross the event horizon, from the perspective of an external observer?

If the particle were a photon, wouldn't it be infinitely redshifted by the time it reached an external observer, and thus be undetectable?

If it were a massive particle at a higher orbit, how would it reduce the overall energy of the black hole? Wouldn't the spontaneous creation of a real, energetic particle cause the black hole to expand, as its causally preceding particle was still slowing down in its infinite descent towards the event horizon?

To expect to be able to observe this radiation seems like a violation of causality and conservation of energy. How have I misinterpreted the phenomena involved?

snippet.textDisplay: Well, that whole pronunciation stuff is messy: In "proper" Latin, it should be [prinkipia] since that's how native speakers would have pronounced it. But we know that stuff only in recent times. Most likely, Newton himself would have pronounced it [prinsipia] or [printsipia]. So, this comes to the idea of "death of the author": Does it matter how the author conceived his own work?
snippet.textOriginal: Well, that whole pronunciation stuff is messy: In "proper" Latin, it should be [prinkipia] since that's how native speakers would have pronounced it. But we know that stuff only in recent times. Most likely, Newton himself would have pronounced it [prinsipia] or [printsipia]. So, this comes to the idea of "death of the author": Does it matter how the author conceived his own work?
